p: Perinatal or intrauterine transmission is the major risk of transmission of HBV in its area of high endemicity [ 1]. Since the last decades, hepatitis B vaccination and immunoglobulin administration provided at birth have been implemented to prevent vertical transmission of HBV [ 2]. However, 50 Mio. new cases of HBV infection are still diagnosed annually due to mother-to-child transmission, MTCT [ 3]. High level of HBV DNA level (HBV > 10 6 IU/mL) and HBeAg positivity during reproductive years [ 4] contribute to the high risk of transmission, particularly in Asian countries [ 5].
